item.title: Kernel density Bayesian inverse reinforcement learning
item.description: A preliminary version appeared in the Symposium on Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference, 2022.

item.title: Probabilistic prediction of material stability: integrating convex hulls into Bayesian active learning
Optimizing the design of spatial genomics studies
Exchangeable trait allocations
item.description: Trait allocations are a class of combinatorial structures in which data may belong to multiple groups and may have different levels of belonging in each group. Often the data are also exchangeable, i.e., their joint distribution is invariant to reordering. In clustering—a special case of trait allocation—exchangeability …

item.title: Priors on exchangeable directed graphs
item.description: Directed graphs occur throughout statistical modeling of networks, and exchangeability is a natural assumption when the ordering of vertices does not matter. There is a deep structural theory for exchangeable undirected graphs, which extends to the directed case via measurable objects known as digraphons …
